problem: Documentation describes arccos(1/3) as 'edge-face angle' but this is imprecise

resolution.definition: Interior angle between two faces meeting at an edge
resolution.proof: Outward face normals satisfy n₁·n₂ = -1/3, so dihedral = π - arccos(-1/3) = arccos(1/3)

incorrect_terminology: edge-face angle (edges lie IN faces, so this is meaningless)
vertex-face-normal angle (this is a different quantity)
correct_terminology: interior angle between faces at an edge

face_angle.description: Angle at vertex within a face

central_angle.description: Angle from center to adjacent vertices

connection_to_gamma.interpretation: Dihedral angle minus inverse pentagonal quantum

action: Replace 'edge-face angle' with 'dihedral angle' in all documentation
